Tools and Technology – Data Scientist EA Create is a collective of content production teams partnering with EA Studios game teams to provide outstanding visuals, audio and technology. Our teams comprise of artists, engineers, technicians, designers and development directors. Worldwide, we combine our teams to form a global group of extraordinary individuals fueled by imagination and a unified passion for creating amazing content and experiences. We are a diverse team, unified through collaboration, culture and craft. The EA Create Tools and Technology Team is looking for accomplished people to help us fulfill our mission of providing creative tools and workflows that allow EA to lead the industry in content quality. Our group strives to build an ecosystem of modular components that are efficient, adjustable to trends and allow for quick iteration of any artistic idea into reality.  The Challenge Ahead: As a Data Scientist on our team, you will build solutions that leverage our extensive library of data for the mass production of assets to be included in our catalogue of AAA titles. You will build and train cutting-edge AI models to empower content creators spanning all aspects of asset creation including character and world building, animation, rigging, audio and scanning. You will report to a team Development Director.  As a Data Scientist you will:  Work in partnership with content creators to design shared services  Design, develop and implement cloud-based AI and machine learning production pipelines  Ensure AI and machine learning production pipelines are scalable, repeatable, cloud agnostic and secure  Apply current and emerging techniques in deep learning, computer vision and other machine learning areas  Collect, clean, manage, analyze, and visualize large sets of data using multiple data platforms, tools and techniques  Who you are:  A minimum of 2+ years of experience in data science  Bachelor’s degree in a related field  Strong expertise in deep learning, in particular computer vision  Expertise in automating machine learning models and building end to end products  Experience with source code management (Perforce, Git)  Effective within public Cloud environments  Understanding of containerization for deploying our solutions  Bonus if you have:  Experience with CI/CD pipelines

Dept Number/Name:  0-3700-000 / Office of Decision Support/Enrollment Planning & Management   College/Division:  Acad Affairs-Student Success   Salary Plan:  Administrative   Job Code/Title : 4725 / Statistical Data Analyst   Salary Range : $51,500 - $65,000   Position Number:  00022804   ORGANIZATIONAL SUMMARY: The Office of Decision Support (ODS) facilitates leadership decision-making by providing data,analysis, business solutions and reporting for USF and to coordinate academic planning, reporting and related needs for USF. ODS supports the University by ensuring competitive performance, compliance with regulations and policies, and institutional accreditation.   POSITION SUMMARY:  The foremost priority of the Statistical Data Analyst is to advance the enrollment planning and management (EPM) agenda of the university by conducting statistical research analyses and modeling. As an analyst in the Office of Decision Support, the position will provide timely, accessible, and quality data and information that will assist in important decision-making. This position is actively involved with Student Success efforts at large providing appropriate data, studies and information.   RESPONSIBILITIES: This position will contribute to the work of the Student Success Reporting & Analysis (SSRA) unit within the Office of Decision Support by: Providing statistical and analytical institutional research, with a focus on enrollment planning and management. Applying research methods, statistical tools, and computer tools in the analysis of university data, primarily with enrollment management data. Understanding and utilizing available data (admissions, financial aid, enrollment) to inform strategic decision-making.  Guiding Enrollment Management staff on enrollment data needs and implications.  Analyzing and interpreting data in a meaningful, accurate and consistent manner.  Preparing research reports for use by stakeholders and university decision-makers using appropriate visual graphs, charts, and tables to communicate research findings.  Demonstrating data management and effectively work with related tools (e.g., SQL, Access). Assisting with development of special projects, ad-hoc requests, research and analytic support to key decision-makers. Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects in a fast-paced working environment.   POSITION QUALIFICATIONS:   MINIMUM:  This position requires a Bachelor's degree in a field directly related to the research or data analysis responsibilities and a minimum of one year of research experience; or a Master's degree in one of the same fields. Progressively responsible work experience may substitute for the college on a year for year basis.   PREFERRED:  A Master's degree in higher education, social science, educational research, applied statistics or relevant discipline  At least three years of demonstrated high-level proficiency in applied statistical research and data analysis, preferably in a higher education setting  Experience with enrollment planning & management, modeling, forecasting  Knowledge of traditional functional areas in enrollment management  Experience with predictive modeling  Creating, maintaining and analyzing operational and longitudinal reporting  High level technical skills and advanced practical experience in statistical data packages (SAS, SPSS, R), data analysis and data management (Excel) experience, database software packages (Access, Oracle), and SQL  Excellent interpersonal and communication skills across all levels at the university, particularly the ability to distill and convey research findings clearly and concisely to multiple audiences and stakeholders, as well as in appropriate forums (Excel, PowerPoint, Word). Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects and activities independently, frequently on tight deadlines, yet maintains the highest standard of research and data quality  2-3 years supervisory experience

Job Description: SUMMARY  The Data Scientist will provide the team with valuable information that can improve the program goals, modernize competency efforts, and standardize data within the Interoperable Networking for Training Readiness and Education in Medicine (INTREMED).   ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES  Evaluate disparate data received as Government Furnished Information (GFI) to provide recommendations to system engineers for the data strategy plan.  Create the data Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) process to help determine the data aggregation plan for INTREMED.  Collaborate with team members to analyze data architecture, data dictionary, system functional descriptions, flow charts, user needs, etc.  Collaborate with stakeholders to confirm improved data metrics within the INTREMED.  Maintain regular and punctual attendance.  Perform other duties as assigned.     MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS  Ph.D. in Mathematics, Computer Science, or a similar field; or a Master’s degree in a comparable field with 5 plus years data scientist role experience.  Must have a minimum of 5 years of experience in a Data Scientist role or equivalent.  Sufficient experience to understand various data types and standards.  Experience with ETL (Extract-Transform-Load) systems.  Experience with Cloud computing technologies, software, and techniques.  COVID VACCINATION  As required by Executive Order 14042, employees of federal contractors (this includes Katmai Government Services and all subsidiary companies) are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 regardless of the employee’s duty location or work arrangement (e.g., company site, government site, telework, work at home, etc.), subject to such exceptions as required by law. If selected, you will be required to be vaccinated against COVID-19 and submit documentation of proof of vaccination by your date of hire or December 8, 2021 (whichever is later). You may request a religious or medical accommodation and should request an accommodation at the earliest opportunity once selected.  SPECIAL SKILLS  Must be able to read, write, and speak fluent English.  Effective interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
